major_cyber_incidents.summary: Largest cybercrime in Brazil's history. Insider at C&M Software paid R$15,000 for credentials, enabling theft of R$541 million ($108M USD) via unauthorized PIX transactions. Operations disrupted 3 hours, one arrest made, R$270M frozen.

Commercial refrigeration manufacturer hit by RansomHub ransomware. IT systems in Brazil and Mexico rendered unavailable, systems isolated to prevent spread. No confirmed data leakage but operations disrupted.

incidents_note: Limited major incidents reported during July 11-17, 2025. Many incidents from this period may not yet be publicly disclosed due to typical reporting delays of 204-220 days in LATAM.

regional_threat_trends.description: 15% year-over-year increase in ransomware attacks across LATAM. RansomHub leading with 14.3% of attacks, followed by Akira (9.65%). 291 LATAM victims documented, up from 254 in 2023.
58% surge in infostealer attacks. Over 2.68 million compromised credentials and 48,000 stolen credit cards in LATAM. SnakeStealer became most detected infostealer in H1 2025.
500% increase compared to H2 2024. Now second most common attack vector after phishing. Manipulates users into executing malicious commands under fake error messages.
Emergence of AI-generated phishing campaigns and deepfakes. 1,265% increase in AI-generated phishing since ChatGPT launch. Automated reconnaissance and attack planning by APT groups.
Government/Military (25%), Healthcare (3,000-4,000 weekly attacks), Financial Services (9% with 4-point increase), Communications/Telecom targeted by nation-state actors.

active_threat_actors.recent_campaigns: Leading ransomware group with 14.3% of LATAM attacks, 59% increase in July 2025. MetLife Latin America attacked Dec 31, 2024. Uses double-extortion, custom variants, exploits VPN vulnerabilities.
236% increase in July 2025, 18 attacks against Spain H1 2024. Announced LockBit 4.0 for Feb 2025. Targets government entities in Brazil, Mexico, Colombia using RaaS model.

active_threat_actors.target_sectors: Business Services, Construction, Critical Infrastructure, Education
active_threat_actors.recent_campaigns: 45% increase in July 2025, 9.65% of LATAM attacks. Uses Rust-based Megazord ransomware with intermittent encryption. Targets Spanish-speaking financial institutions.
Brazil-based group deploying Mispadu trojan. Active phishing campaign impersonating Mexico's CFDI system. Targets FIs across LATAM using regional financial themes.

statistical_overview.total_incidents: 2,569 attacks per organization per week in LATAM (39% above global average)
statistical_overview.average_detection_time: 204-220 days to identify, 70-75 days to contain in LATAM
